recipes.subtitle: Cream-filled choux pastry with chocolate glaze
recipes.description: These traditional French éclairs are made from airy choux pastry, filled with rich vanilla pastry cream, and topped with a glossy chocolate glaze. A delicate and luxurious dessert loved across the world.
method: Make choux pastry: boil butter and water, stir in flour. Cool, then beat in eggs one at a time.
Pipe into logs and bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25–30 minutes until golden.
Make pastry cream: whisk yolks, sugar, cornstarch. Heat milk, temper yolks, cook until thick. Add vanilla and chill.
Fill éclairs with cream. Melt chocolate with cream and spoon over tops.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.subtitle: Classic chewy chocolate chip cookies
recipes.description: These classic chocolate chip cookies are golden on the edges, soft and chewy in the center, and loaded with chocolate chips. Perfect with a glass of cold milk, they are a timeless favorite for all ages.
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda.
In another bowl, beat butter, sugars, and salt until creamy. Add vanilla and eggs, beat well.
Gradually add flour mixture and stir in chocolate chips.
Drop tablespoons of dough onto the baking sheet. Bake for 9–11 minutes until golden brown.
Cool on wire racks before serving.

recipes.name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
recipes.subtitle: Soft and chewy with oats and raisins
recipes.description: These oatmeal raisin cookies are packed with hearty oats, plump raisins, and warm spices. With a chewy texture and comforting flavor, they’re a wholesome treat for breakfast or anytime snacking.
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking tray with parchment.
In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In another bowl, cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla.
Add flour mixture, then stir in oats and raisins.
Scoop onto tray and bake 10–12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool completely before serving.

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.subtitle: Soft, nutty and melt-in-your-mouth
recipes.description: These peanut butter cookies are rich and full of nutty flavor. They’re soft inside with a slightly crisp edge and the perfect balance of salty and sweet—ideal for peanut butter lovers.
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Cream butter, peanut butter, and sugars. Add egg and vanilla.
Mix in dry ingredients. Roll dough into balls and place on tray.
Flatten with fork in a criss-cross pattern.
Bake 10–12 minutes until edges are golden. Let cool.

recipes.name: Sugar Cookies
recipes.subtitle: Soft, buttery, and perfect for decorating
recipes.description: Classic sugar cookies that are soft, buttery, and hold their shape well. Ideal for decorating during the holidays or enjoying plain with a cup of tea. Simple, sweet, and satisfying.
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and baking powder in a bowl.
In another bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add egg and extracts.
Gradually add dry ingredients. Roll into balls and place on tray.
Flatten slightly and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake 8–10 minutes until edges are golden. Cool on racks.

recipes.name: Vanilla Cupcakes
recipes.subtitle: Soft and fluffy classic vanilla cupcakes
recipes.description: These vanilla cupcakes are light, fluffy, and topped with a creamy vanilla buttercream frosting. Perfect for birthdays, celebrations, or just a sweet treat with tea or coffee.
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line cupcake tin with liners.
In a bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time and beat well.
Mix in vanilla. Alternately add flour and milk, beginning and ending with flour.
Fill cupcake liners 2/3 full. Bake 18–20 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool completely before frosting.

recipes.name: Chocolate Cupcakes
recipes.subtitle: Rich and moist with chocolate frosting
recipes.description: These chocolate cupcakes are moist, rich, and deeply chocolatey. Topped with smooth chocolate ganache or buttercream, they’re a dream for every chocolate lover.
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a cupcake tray.
Whisk together flour, cocoa, baking powder, soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, sugars, oil, and vanilla until smooth.
Add dry ingredients alternately with buttermilk, mixing until combined.
Fill liners and bake for 18–20 minutes. Let cool before frosting.

recipes.name: Classic French Fries
recipes.subtitle: Crispy golden fries like the fast food chains
recipes.description: These classic French fries are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Fried to golden perfection, they’re seasoned with salt and served hot with ketchup or your favorite dip.
method: Peel and cut potatoes into thin sticks.
Soak in cold water for 30 minutes, then drain and pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or pot to 350°F (175°C).
Fry potatoes in batches until golden and crisp, about 5 minutes.
Remove to paper towels, season with salt, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Masala Fries
recipes.subtitle: Spicy Indian-style fries
recipes.description: Masala fries are an exciting twist on the regular French fries. Tossed with a bold mix of Indian spices, they’re spicy, crispy, and packed with flavor—great as a snack or side dish.
method: Soak cut potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes.
Drain and toss with corn flour and spices.
Heat oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with extra chaat masala.
Serve hot with ketchup or mint chutney.

recipes.name: Daal Chana
recipes.subtitle: Traditional Pakistani split chickpea lentils
recipes.description: Daal Chana is a flavorful and hearty lentil curry made with split chickpeas, cooked with onions, tomatoes, and aromatic spices. It's perfect with roti or rice and often topped with fried garlic or sliced green chilies.
ingredients: 1 cup chana daal (split chickpeas), soaked 2 hours
method: In a pot, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add soaked chana daal and 3 cups water. Cover and cook for 35–40 minutes or until daal is soft.
Mash lightly and adjust consistency. Garnish with coriander and green chilies.

recipes.name: Daal Masoor
recipes.subtitle: Simple and quick red lentil curry
recipes.description: Daal Masoor is a light and nutritious red lentil dish that cooks quickly and is full of flavor. It’s great for a simple weeknight dinner served with rice or chapati.
method: Rinse red lentils and add to pot with 3 cups water.
Add turmeric, red chili, and salt. Bring to boil then simmer until lentils are soft.
In a separate pan, heat oil and fry cumin, garlic, and onion until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Mix this tadka into the lentils.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
recipes.subtitle: Protein-rich salad with fresh Mediterranean flavors
recipes.description: This chickpea salad is refreshing, colorful, and packed with nutrients. It combines cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese with a zesty lemon dressing—perfect for lunch or as a side dish.
method: Combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomato, onion, olives, and feta in a large bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Quinoa Avocado Salad
recipes.subtitle: Nutrient-rich salad with creamy avocado and zesty dressing
recipes.description: A light and healthy quinoa salad combined with fresh vegetables and creamy avocado. High in fiber and protein, it’s perfect for clean eating or a light lunch.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
method: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
In a bowl, combine quinoa, avocado, cucumber, bell pepper, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and mix gently. Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Daal Makhni
recipes.subtitle: Creamy black lentil curry cooked with butter and spices
recipes.description: Daal Makhni is a rich and creamy North Indian lentil dish made from black lentils and red kidney beans. Slow-cooked with aromatic spices, butter, and cream, it's a comforting and hearty meal best enjoyed with naan or basmati rice.
method: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight.
Pressure cook with water and salt until soft (around 20–25 minutes).
In a pan, heat butter. Add cumin, onions, and ginger garlic paste. Sauté until golden.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook till oil separates.
Add boiled lentils and beans with some water. Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add cream, mix well, and cook for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

recipes.name: Daal Mash
recipes.subtitle: Traditional Pakistani white lentil dish
recipes.description: Daal Mash is made using white lentils (urad daal), known for their creamy texture and nutty taste. Cooked with minimal spices and topped with fried garlic, it’s a flavorful yet light daal, often enjoyed with paratha or naan.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and green chilies for garnish
method: Soak urad daal for 1 hour, then boil with turmeric and salt until soft but not mushy.
In a pan, heat oil, add onion and ginger garlic paste. Sauté till golden.
Add tomatoes, red chili, and a splash of water. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked daal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat a little oil and fry garlic slices until golden. Pour over daal as tempering.
Garnish with green chilies and coriander. Serve with naan or roti.

recipes.name: Chicken Club Sandwich
recipes.subtitle: Triple-layered grilled sandwich packed with chicken, eggs, and veggies
recipes.description: The Chicken Club Sandwich is a classic triple-decker sandwich layered with grilled chicken, egg, fresh lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise. It's toasted to perfection and ideal for lunch or tea-time snacks.
method: Toast the bread slices until golden and crisp.
Spread mayo on all slices. Layer one slice with lettuce, shredded chicken, and salt/pepper.
Place second slice, layer with egg slices and tomato.
Top with third slice of bread. Press lightly.
Trim edges and cut diagonally into triangles. Serve with fries or chips.
